labels.analysis: The MCP Server "Gemini Email Subject Generator" is primarily focused on enhancing email communication by generating engaging email subjects and detailed thinking processes using Google's Gemini Flash 2 model. The core functionality revolves around content creation, specifically for emails, leveraging AI to improve engagement and effectiveness. The optional settings tool suggests some level of user management or server configuration, but this appears secondary to the main email subject generation functionality.
labels.reasoning: The primary function of generating email subjects fits best under the "Content Creation" category, as it involves creating engaging text intended for communication. The AI-driven aspect of the tool suggests relevance to "AI/ML Tools," but this is secondary. The optional settings tool hints at possible "Development Tools" or "Server Management," but these are not central to the primary use case.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@falahgs/gemini-email-subject-generator-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: geminiApiKey
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: Google Gemini API key for AI subject generation
